column2: WYOMING DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. When you hear the warning signal or see the warning lamps of an emergency vehicle, you must:
column4: drive slowly until the emergency vehicle has passed.
column6: provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column8: stop as quickly as you can.

column2: 2. Hydroplaning is usually caused by:
3. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
column8: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 4. The picture shows:
5. When driving at night, if an approaching car is using its high-beams you should:
column4: turn your lights on and off.
column6: look toward the left edge of the road.
column8: look toward the right edge of the road.

column2: 6. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
7. This road sign means:
8. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 9. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column6: is the best option during winter.
column8: causes the front wheels to lock.

column2: 10. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
11. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column6: if you have the green light.
column8: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 12. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: When it has just begun to rain.
column6: If it's been raining several hours.
column8: When it's been raining from at least one hour.

column2: 13. This road sign is:
14. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column6: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.
column8: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.

column2: 15. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 16. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.

column2: 17. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers should:
column6: be ready to sound the horn.

column2: 18. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is a good defensive driving technique.
column8: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

column2: 19. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
20. Bicyclists making a left hand turn:
column8: should wait on the right side of the road.

column2: 21. At a crosswalk:
column6: construction workers must yield to drivers.

column2: 22. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column8: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 23. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column6: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

column2: 24. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.

column2: 25. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column6: come to a complete stop, then proceed.

column2: 26. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column6: drive with both hands on steering wheel.

column2: 27. A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You must:
column4: stop until all the children have left the bus.
column6: reduce your speed, change lanes and pass.
column8: stop until the lights stop flashing.

column2: 28. Signs that indicate a No Passing Zone tell drivers that:
column4: it is not safe to pass.
column6: not passing other vehicles is prohibited.
column8: passing is only permitted in daylight hours.

column2: 29. When you change lanes:
column4: look in the left side mirror.
column6: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 30. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 31. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: cut abruptly in front of it.
column6: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 32. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
33. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 34. Some roadway surfaces are more slippery during certain times or at certain places. Which of the following is more likely to be slippery on cold, wet days?
35. This road sign means:
36. Green and white signs:
column4: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column6: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column8: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 37. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 38. When another vehicle is passing you:
column4: stay in your lane and reduce speed.
column6: pull your vehicle as far to the right as possible without leaving the pavement.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain speed unless there is an emergency.

column2: 39. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 40. The picture shows a _________ sign.
41. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
42. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 43. This sign indicates:
44. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
45. This sign indicates:
46. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 47. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
48. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 49. This sign means:
50. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
